channel.title: Merchanting?
channel.description: Post your techniques on merchanting if you want to share. Currently I started play rs a little bit again and I have an account that can mine pure ess for cash. That is alot of work for not alot of profit. So I need ideas on what to merchant. So post what you merchant.

item.title: Merchanting?
item.dc:creator: @XharveyX XharveyX
item.description:
@XharveyX wrote:

what i do is make a load of emerald rings and i make an ok profit. I dont play rs much but i know this, dont make necklaces, no-one buys em

Read full topic

item.title: Merchanting?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

A long time ago when I still had money on my account, I finished the Throne of Miscellania and Royal Trouble quests.

After that, I maxed my approval rating, sold my gear and invested some money in the coffers.
I put as many servants as I could on flax, and the rest on maple logs.

I then left Runescape to come to Moparscape, going back to Runescape for a minute a day to keep my approval rating at 100%.

After what felt like 2 or 3 weeks, I had found that I had gone from 4 mil total to about 8 mil.

The prices of both flax and maple logs are currently low, but the seeds you get from the maple trees can sell for a lot if you’re lucky. At one point I had about 1.3 mil worth of seeds.

Note: You must have at least 750k in the coffers at all times to fully benefit from this.
Since I had sold my armor, I always kept around 2 mil in them.

Read full topic

item.title: Merchanting?

Post your techniques on merchanting if you want to share. Currently I started play rs a little bit again and I have an account that can mine pure ess for cash. That is alot of work for not alot of profit. So I need ideas on what to merchant. So post what you merchant.
[/quote]mine coal at barbarian village? Last time i checked 1k coal sold for 1m Coulda changed now

Coal = 182gp each

182 x 1,000 = 182,000

1k coal = 182k GP[/quote]thanks for clarifyring that davidude, i guess they did change the prices -_-

that’s still more than pure essance, but more work.

item.title: Merchanting?
item.dc:creator: @billygotshot billygotshot
item.description:
@billygotshot wrote:

[quote=“davidude36, post:4, topic:206641”]I had a little merchanting scheme going about a month ago which I kept secret as to not let it be ruined. Though now Jagex has nerfed it so I shall tell you about what I did.

First I would buy all the uncharged Pharaohs sceptres I could afford on the grand exchange for about 250k each or something. Then I would buy I think it was 4 gold artifacts per sceptre. Then I would teleport to the pyramid plunder pyramid. I would charge up all the sceptres and then tele back to varrock. Then sell them on the grand exchange for like 300k each.

This stopped working when they made it so that the uncharged and charged sceptres must be the same price.

Made a good mil or two using this method.

To be honest there are no ways to merchant any more. You might as well just stick to mining pure essence to make money, if you have a few runecrafting pouches its pretty much a sure fire way to make a lot of money.[/quote]

Well I have a few friends on rs who have made a lot of money in a few weeks without doing anything but waiting to buy or sell certain items in ge. One of my friends started out with a few hundred k and now has 100m+. So I know there are items that people merchant but I do not know of any. I have looked for some items but it takes way to long to sell them.

Read full topic

item.title: Merchanting?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

I had a little merchanting scheme going about a month ago which I kept secret as to not let it be ruined. Though now Jagex has nerfed it so I shall tell you about what I did.

First I would buy all the uncharged Pharaohs sceptres I could afford on the grand exchange for about 250k each or something. Then I would buy I think it was 4 gold artifacts per sceptre. Then I would teleport to the pyramid plunder pyramid. I would charge up all the sceptres and then tele back to varrock. Then sell them on the grand exchange for like 300k each.

This stopped working when they made it so that the uncharged and charged sceptres must be the same price.

Made a good mil or two using this method.

To be honest there are no ways to merchant any more. You might as well just stick to mining pure essence to make money, if you have a few runecrafting pouches its pretty much a sure fire way to make a lot of money.

Read full topic

item.title: Merchanting?
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

if you have enough money for rares, buy them at 5% below the normal cost, and sell for 10% more of what you bought. You can have 5% lower, or higher.

Read full topic
